title: "Ranked is about skill and not at all a coinflip"
body:
First game is a 25 kill Vayne top who carries us so hard half of us could have afk'd and they were so damn good and so positive despite our mid and jungling arguing with each other so hard they would die standing still in the middle of lanes multiple times. STILL they were super nice and positive and hard carried us.


Very next game we have 2/11 Vayne with 2 accidental kills cause of the Automatic auto attacking they still had turned on as they come mid at 5 mids to troll, flaming their support, and "split push" and spam surrender on cooldown while mocking us about trolling in the lobby after the game.


Ranked is literally a coin flip. You either get the nicest hard carry Vayne or the hard flaming troll who ints to make their support angry.

Back in the day, League played out as a slower, more methodical game. Not everyone had the mobility to dash and run across the map in the fraction of a second. Positioning, both micro and macro, were very important. Gaining an advantage took some real good shot calling and smart engaging. And people often didn't die in an instant unless you were a fed fizz or leblanc taking out the underleveled caster support. 
You had to work up to winning the game. Just acing the other team didn't mean taking out their whole base in one fell swoop.
And the fact that people lived longer meant that team fights were a lot closer. There were a lot less clean aces back in the day. These days I watch competitive League and am baffled how often a team fight results in a clean ace. There ought to be a lot more close fights, but most of the time, one person gets caught out and is bursted down and the ensuing team fight becomes an afterthought.
The riot buff probably also plays a part in how disparate team fights are. 
At any rate, I'm just an old man who used to play league. What do I know?

I find it ironic that some of those defending this severely flawed system are saying 7 games are a toss up. You need to win the other three games to get 65% wr and rank up. Or you win 40% you lose 40% and you fight for 20%.  If you are only having a serious competitive game 20-30% of the time that shows how seriously bad the system is as it stands. 

I think a lot of the problems that cause rants, other than just having such a high percentage of non-competitive “coin flip” games is that it tends to run in cycles.   You can get a hot streak and win 7-8 out of 10 then all of a sudden bam. You can’t even get a competitive game for a whole weekend even though your still playing well personally.  

To further the point in how bad the ranking and mmr systems are, when you watch or read “how to rank up” videos or post the first recommendation is to op.gg your team.  If “dodging” is first step you need to take in ranking up the system is seriously flawed.

The second recommendation to ranking up is to only play certain rolls.  That show all rolls are not created or valued equally by rito.  This means your personal skill has little to no value on your rank.  It’s also part of the reason why there is a need for autofill. Everyone needs to play the rank up mode of the moment.   The system needs to incorporate a players personal skill at all positions into its ranking system.

Sticking with the how to rank up guides I’ve seen many suggesting not to play ranked during high troll time.  Many weekends or summer.  Again showing there is a huge problem with rito controlling it’s games.  Yes rito can do things to help reduce the trolls.  They just don’t because it would take some effort that doesn’t directly lead to income. No one thinks of the indirect income that is lost due to so many players having a negative game experience. 

Last thing I want to touch on for toxic players and player currently under punishment of some sort.  It was suggested they be banned from rank while the time is being served.   The issue with that as stated was then it hurts the normals.   Well I would suggest that they don’t get into normal normals either.   They would joun up for normals, but then the system would identify them as “under punishment” and put them into a separate group to play with other under punishment players. Yes that might give longer queues but you know what, they are being punished and longer queues  will have a larger impact on player behavior than not being able to chat ever could hope for.

I disagree. They will be and this should be a player expectation.  There is a concept in Elo and MMR called uncertainty. The systems do not and realistically can not know ones  "skill" with 100% accuracy with 0 data. Elo and MMR ratings are meant to represent a Mean range of performances and become more accurate over time. So some times those 50% fair games are going to be onsided shitshows. This does not break the system, it does not make them flawed, because there is nothing out there that can account for everything with the accuracy required to predict skill off 0 data.  Skill is a mix of innate talent and gained knowlage.   I'm going to give a slighty abstract analogy here to highlight the difficulty of accomplishing a predictive system that accounts for skill.  There are 150 hypothetical people in a room. I want you to rate them by how well they can make tikka masala competitvly vs echother, cooking is after all a skill and you can judge who is a better cook by the end result. Now You know none of them, You don't get to see them, you don't get to hear them, talk to them, your not allowed their names, your allowed 0 interaction with them.  How accurate do you think your going to be when your asked to rate them befor takeing a bite of the end result?  To many people are expecting and asking of MM  and MMR this as they expect it to know player skill with out games played. 

Next up, expectations for what a mean range can mean. People need to keep in mind that a mean  average can be identical but have different values. (100,50,0)  (50,50,50)  (0, 150,0.) ( 77,46,27) All 4 sets have the same mean. Applied to League this means that players even at the exact same MMR with 100% accuracy to their "skill" do not have identical best and worst case expectations.

More things impact it. Player skill changes, new champions with low knowledge can hurt. Buffs can help, nerfs can hurt. Your Mains being banned can hurt, your hard counter being banned can help. ETC ETC. then funky fringe cases that probably are not of any statistical significance still apply if you only look at single matches, like  if some one uses another persons account cuz then all data prior is invalidated.

The nice think about MMR is it does get to a workably fair range eventually, it never locks you in so changes positive or negative will move you correctly up and down the ladder.
The down side, time invested, it requires data points. Also despite best efforts of the MM it will make you some trash games. It does not account for player behaviors. 

Its workable and its better then a massive # of other options. Its also superior to 0 attempts for match making.

I love MMR systems, I am not wild that most players are completely unrealistic of their expectations. I don't think riots is inherently the best option out there because I feel they care to much about player perception. Blatantly my oppenion but Duoing needs to be reworked to function of hidden MMR ranges to never go past what MM would build as a  "fair" match. Additionally this season by adding new tiers (this only makes players feel a bit better about things in multiple divisions with 0 actual impact on how MMR functions.) positional que (Rewards OTPs/players with low champion pools, make folks feel better about getting auto filled.) and changing the starting MMR for "newbies" (addresses the silver complaints about getting new players in their matches... despite the fact they would end up with more wins from weak players then losses.)

End result, I don't think It breaks MMR given that I can look at the ladder and see its still moveing good players up and bad ones down. I do think it impacts match quality. I largly think player behavior systems are the best place to invest time and money currently to make the game more enjoyable… MMR wont deal with toxicity besides moving people so toxic they lose games frequently enough for being that toxic.

Apparently before I started playing, there was a more visible rating system; it was changed to the Ranked Tier system because players were disheartened to see their position on the ladder not move very much (even though the ladder was the whole server). The thing is, now everything is hidden behind Tiers, we actually have less of an indication how good someone actually is... We have a general idea, but even that is slightly useless when you take into account Demotion Protection and Promotions. 

Personally, I'd much rather go back to that old system; I'd also like to see the back of variable LP change, Promotions and Demotion Protection. Another good addition would be to modulate MMR based on number of games; if the system can take, say, 10s longer to put people below 100 total games (across all Seasons) with others of that play rate, then it probably should. I've seen quite a few games where one team has a slightly higher win rate on a lower number of games, vs a team with a lower win rate but far more games played; and almost always the more experienced team wins. winning 60% of 10 games is far less statistically accurate than 60% of 100 games when assessing skill.

You mentioned things like different win rates on different champions, and whilst Riot _could_ really refine things down by making you pick before listing, that really would screw queue times into the deep unacceptable. I agree that there are variables in the MMR system that are never going to be controlled. That said I would like to see Autofill go away as well; Ranked is meant to be about playing your best, and being thrown into an off-role you almost never play isn't really your best... (I am a Supp Main though, so it's not like I've ever really had an issue with queue times...).

It is nice to see a well-reasoned response though, rather than either vitriol or pointless anecdotal/purely opinion-based spurge (like we're seeing with the 'Should there be bans in ARAM?' discussion right now; it's all either 'I only play ARAM and I hated bans' or rants about ARAM-only accounts).
